Parents, we need your help! It is absolutely critical that our state has an accurate census count. The data collection from this will be the basis for all levels of legislative representation for the next decade and determines the amount of federal funding that will be distributed to programs in our community. The funding from the 2020 Census impacts programs that we use every day; such as Title I Grants, the National School Lunch Program, the Special Education Grant Program (IDEA), and many more.

Our parents can do it from the safety of their homes in one of three ways: online at my2020census.gov, over the phone at 1-844-330-2020, or by mail using the paper questionnaire they received.

Please make sure you take 10 minutes to complete the census!

Attention SAIL community!

As we have communicated throughout the last week, the safety and well-being of our students and staff are our primary concern. Out of an abundance of caution and In response to Governor Kemp's declaration that the State of Georgia is under a Public Health State of Emergency, SAIL will be closed March 17th through the 20th. In the meantime, our teachers will be providing online opportunities to ensure our students continue to receive the same quality education they would if they were on campus. Many teachers also sent home work in advance of this announcement. If you have specific questions about your child’s assignments, please email the teacher directly.

Thank you for your understanding!

Gene Dunn
Chief Academic Officer

At the beginning of the school year, I created an "Accreditation Team" to begin the process of earning accreditation for SAIL. As we were submitting our application to AdvancED, a merger was happening. The new name is now COGNIA. Once the Accreditation Team completed our Readiness Evaluation, a representative from COGNIA reviewed our answers. He then visited the school today, walked the building and met with the team to discuss our answers to determine if SAIL is prepared for the accreditation process.

I'm happy to announce that he is recommending that SAIL move forward and begin the next steps of accreditation!

This is an exciting time for SAIL. I'm so thankful for our committee for driving the accreditation process. Please take a moment to thank our Accreditation Team members:

post_text:
Parents,

Please tune in to Channel 6 news for a story on the SAIL 2nd graders and how they were studying about President Jimmy Carter. The students celebrated his upcoming 95th birthday, attended a virtual tour of the Jimmy Carter Museum AND Mr. Dunn read a book to them that was written by President Carter and illustrated by his daughter, Amy.

What a fun day of SAILing!!!

Mr. D
